detaileddescription.para: This file contains the defintion of the core POZYX functions and variables

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8_t reg_address, const uint8_t *pData, int size)
memberdef.name: i2cWriteWrite

detaileddescription.para:
Internal function that writes a number of bytes to a specfified Pozyx register This function implements the I2C interface as described in the datasheet on our website Input values:
reg_address
Pozyx address to write to
pData
reference to the data that needs to be writen
size
size in byte of data to be written
POZYX_FAILURE: error occured during the process POZYX_SUCCESS: successful execution of the function Writes a number of bytes to the specified pozyx register address using I2C

Internal function that writes and reads a number of bytes to call a specfic Pozyx register function This function implements the I2C interface as described in the datasheet on our website Input values:
write_data
reference to the data that needs to be writen
write_len
size in byte of data to be written
read_data
reference to the pointer where the read data should be stored
read_len
size in byte of data to be read
POZYX_FAILURE: error occured during the process POZYX_SUCCESS: successful execution of the function Call a register function using I2C with given parameters
Internal function that sets the _interrupt variable on an Arduino interrupt
The interrupt handler for the pozyx device: keeping it uber short!
This function calls the waitForFlag function in polling mode. After this, the previous mode is reset.

parameterdescription.para: the exepected Pozyx interrupt. Possible values are POZYX_INT_STATUS_ERR, POZYX_INT_STATUS_POS, POZYX_INT_STATUS_IMU, POZYX_INT_STATUS_RX_DATA, POZYX_INT_STATUS_FUNC, or combinations.
maximum waiting time in milliseconds for flag to occur
a pointer that will contain the value of the interrupt status register
event occured.
event did not occur, this function timed out.

detaileddescription.para: Read from the registers of the connected Pozyx shield.

reg_address
the specific register address to start reading from
pData
a pointer to the data thas will be read
size
the number of bytes to read
POZYX_SUCCESS
success.
POZYX_FAILURE
function failed.
Reads a number of bytes from the specified pozyx register address using I2C
Write to the registers of the connected Pozyx shield.

reg_address
the specific register address to start writing to
pData
a pointer to the data thas will be written
size
the number of bytes to write
POZYX_SUCCESS
success.
POZYX_FAILURE
function failed.
Writes a number of bytes to the specified pozyx register address using I2C

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t reg_address, uint8_t *params=NULL, int param_size=0, uint8_t *pData=NULL, int size=0)
memberdef.name: regFunction

detaileddescription.para: Call a register funcion on the connected Pozyx shield.

reg_address
the specific register address of the function
params
this is the pointer to a parameter array required for the specific function that is called
param_size
the number of bytes in the params array
pData
a pointer to the data thas will be read
size
the number of bytes that will be stored in pData
POZYX_SUCCESS
success.
POZYX_FAILURE
function failed.
Call a register function using i2c with given parameters, the data from the function is stored in pData

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t destination, uint8_t reg_address, uint8_t *pData, int size)
memberdef.name: remoteRegWrite

detaileddescription.para: Write to the registers on a remote Pozyx device (anchor or tag).

destination
this is the network id of the receiving Pozyx tag
reg_address
the specific register address to start writing to
pData
a pointer to the data thas will be written
size
the number of bytes to write
POZYX_SUCCESS
success.
POZYX_FAILURE
function failed.
POZYX_TIMEOUT
function timed out, no response received.
Wirelessly write a number of bytes to a specified register address on a remote Pozyx device using UWB.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t destination, uint8_t reg_address, uint8_t *params=NULL, int param_size=0, uint8_t *pData=NULL, int size=0)
memberdef.name: remoteRegFunctionWithoutCheck

detaileddescription.para: Wait until the Pozyx shields has raised a specfic event flag or until timeout. This functions halts the process flow until a specific event flag was raised by the Pozyx shield. The event flag is checked by reading the contents of the reg:POZYX_INT_STATUS register. This function can work in both polled and interupt mode

parameterdescription.para: the exepected Pozyx interrupt. Possible values are POZYX_INT_STATUS_ERR, POZYX_INT_STATUS_POS, POZYX_INT_STATUS_IMU, POZYX_INT_STATUS_RX_DATA, POZYX_INT_STATUS_FUNC, or combinations.
maximum waiting time in milliseconds for flag to occur
a pointer that will contain the value of the interrupt status register
event occured.
event did not occur, this function timed out.

detaileddescription.para: Does the same as the remoteRegFunction, but doesn't wait for nearly as long and doesn't care about whether the function worked.

parameterdescription.para: the exepected Pozyx interrupt. Possible values are POZYX_INT_STATUS_ERR, POZYX_INT_STATUS_POS, POZYX_INT_STATUS_IMU, POZYX_INT_STATUS_RX_DATA, POZYX_INT_STATUS_FUNC, or combinations.
maximum waiting time in milliseconds for flag to occur
a pointer that will contain the value of the interrupt status register
event occured.
event did not occur, this function timed out.

memberdef.argsstring: (boolean print_result=false, int mode=MODE_INTERRUPT, int interrupts=POZYX_INT_MASK_ALL, int interrupt_pin=POZYX_INT_PIN0)
memberdef.name: begin

detaileddescription.para: Initiates the Pozyx shield. This function initializes the pozyx device. It will verify that the device is functioning correctly by means of the self-test, and it will configure the interrupts. See the register reg:POZYX_INT_MASK for more details about the interrupts.

parameterdescription.para: outputs the result of the function to the Serial output
The modus of the system: MODE_POLLING or MODE_INTERRUPT

defines which events trigger interrupts. This field is only required for MODE_INTERRUPT. Possible values are bit-wise combinations of POZYX_INT_MASK_ERR, POZYX_INT_MASK_POS, POZYX_INT_MASK_IMU, POZYX_INT_MASK_RX_DATA and POZYX_INT_MASK_FUNC. Use POZYX_INT_MASK_ALL to trigger on all events.
Pozyx interrupt pin: POZYX_INT_PIN0 or POZYX_INT_PIN1. This field is only required for MODE_INTERRUPT.
success.
function failed.

detaileddescription.para: Wirelessly transmit data to a remote pozyx device. This function combines writeTXBufferData and sendTXBufferData to write data to the transmit buffer and immediately transmit it.

parameterdescription.para: the network id of the device that should receive the data. A value of 0 will result in a broadcast
pointer to the data that should be transmitted
number of bytes to transmit
success.
function failed.

detaileddescription.para: Write data bytes in the transmit buffer. This function writes bytes in the transmit buffer without sending it yet.

parameterdescription.para: the array with data bytes
size of the data array
The offset in the memory
success.
function failed.

detaileddescription.para: Wirelessly transmit data. Wirelessly transmit the contents of the transmit buffer over UWB.

parameterdescription.para: the network id of the device that should receive the data. A value of 0 will result in a broadcast.
success.
function failed.

detaileddescription.para: Read data bytes from receive buffer. This function reads the bytes from the receive buffer from the last received message.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to where the data will be stored
the number of bytes to read from the receive buffer.

detaileddescription.para: Obtain the network id of the connected Pozyx device. The network id is a unique 16bit identifier determined based on the hardware components. When the system is reset the orignal value is restored

parameterdescription.para: reference to the network_id pointer to store the data
success.

detaileddescription.para: Overwrite the network id. This function overwrites the network id of the pozyx device either locally or remotely. The network id must be unique within a network. When the system is reset the orignal network id is restored.

parameterdescription.para: the new network id
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.

detaileddescription.para: Obtain the current UWB settings. Functions to retrieve the current UWB settings. In order to communicate, two pozyx devices must have exactly the same UWB settings.

parameterdescription.para: reference to the UWB settings object to store the data
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.
function failed.
function timed out, no response received.

detaileddescription.para: Overwrite the UWB settings. This function overwrites the UWB settings such as UWB channel, gain, PRF, etc. In order to communicate, two pozyx devices must have exactly the same UWB settings. Upon reset, the default UWB settings will be loaded.

parameterdescription.para: reference to the new UWB settings. If the gain_db is set to 0, it will automatically load the default gain value for the given uwb paramters.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.
function failed.
function timed out, no response received.

detaileddescription.para: Overwrite the UWB settings except the gain. This function overwrites the UWB settings such as UWB channel, PRF, etc. In order to communicate, two pozyx devices must have exactly the same UWB settings. Upon reset, the default UWB settings will be loaded.

parameterdescription.para: reference to the new UWB settings. If the gain_db is set to 0, it will automatically load the default gain value for the given uwb paramters.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.
function failed.
function timed out, no response received.

detaileddescription.para: Set the Ultra-wideband frequency channel. This function sets the ultra-wideband (UWB) frequency channel used for transmission and reception. For wireless communication, both the receiver and transmitter must be on the same UWB channel. More information can be found in the register reg:POZYX_UWB_CHANNEL.

parameterdescription.para: the channel number, possible values are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 7.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.
function failed.

detaileddescription.para: Get the Ultra-wideband frequency channel. This function reads the ultra-wideband (UWB) frequency channel used for transmission and reception. For wireless communication, both the receiver and transmitter must be on the same UWB channel. More information can be found in the register reg:POZYX_UWB_CHANNEL.

parameterdescription.para: the channel number currently set, possible values are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 7.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.
function failed.
function timed out, no response received.

detaileddescription.para: configure the UWB transmission power.

setting a large TX gain may cause the system to fall out of regulation. Applications that require regulations must set an appropriate TX gain to meet the spectral mask of your region. This can be verified with a spectrum analyzer. This function configures the UWB transmission power gain. The default value is different for each UWB channel. Setting a larger transmit power will result in a larger range. For increased communication range (which is two-way), both the transmitter and the receiver must set the appropriate transmit power. Changing the UWB channel will reset the power to the default value.

parameterdescription.para: the transmission gain in dB. Possible values are between 0dB and 33.5dB, with a resolution of 0.5dB.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used.
success.
function failed.
function timed out, no response received.

detaileddescription.para: Obtain the UWB transmission power.
This function obtains the configured UWB transmission power gain. The default value is different for each UWB channel. Changing the UWB channel will reset the TX power to the default value.

parameterdescription.para: the configured transmission gain in dB. Possible values are between 0dB and 33.5dB, with a resolution of 0.5dB.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used.
success.
function failed.
function timed out, no response received.

detaileddescription.para: Trigger a software reset of the Pozyx device. Function that will trigger the reset of the system. This will reload all configurations from flash memory, or to their default values.

parameterdescription.para: optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used.

detaileddescription.para: Function for turning the leds on and off. This function allows you to turn one of the 4 LEDs on the Pozyx board on or off. By default, the LEDs are controlled by the Pozyx system to give status information. This can be changed using the function setLedConfig.

parameterdescription.para: the led number to be controlled, value between 1, 2, 3 or 4.
the state to set the selected led to. Can be 0 (led is off) or 1 (led is on)
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.
function failed.
function timed out, no response received.

optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used

detaileddescription.para: Function to configure the interrupts. Function to configure the interrupts by means of the interrupt mask from the register reg:POZYX_INT_MASK. The interrupt mask is used to determine which event trigger an interrupt.

parameterdescription.para: reference to the interrupt mask to be written. Bit-wise combinations of the following flags are allowed: POZYX_INT_MASK_ERR, POZYX_INT_MASK_POS, POZYX_INT_MASK_IMU, POZYX_INT_MASK_RX_DATA, POZYX_INT_MASK_FUNC.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used

memberdef.name: setConfigGPIO

detaileddescription.para: Configure the GPIOs. Function to set the configuration mode of the GPIO for the given pin number. This is performed by writing to the reg:POZYX_CONFIG_GPIO1 up to reg:POZYX_CONFIG_GPIO4 register.

parameterdescription.para: the GPIO pin to update. Possible values are 1, 2, 3 or 4.
the mode of GPIO. Possible values POZYX_GPIO_DIGITAL_INPUT, POZYX_GPIO_PUSHPULL, POZYX_GPIO_OPENDRAIN
pull configuration of GPIO. Possible values are POZYX_GPIO_NOPULL, POZYX_GPIO_PULLUP, POZYX_GPIO_PULLDOWN.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.
function failed.
function timed out, no response received.

detaileddescription.para: Configure the LEDs. This function configures the 6 LEDs on the pozyx device by writing to the register reg:POZYX_LED_CTRL. More specifically, the function configures which LEDs give system information. By default all the LEDs will give system information.

parameterdescription.para: default: the configuration to be set. See POZYX_LED_CTRL for details.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used.
success.
function failed.
function timed out, no response received.

memberdef.argsstring: (int type, uint8_t registers[]=NULL, int num_registers=0, uint16_t remote_id=NULL)
memberdef.name: saveConfiguration

detaileddescription.para:
Save (part of) the configuration to Flash memory.
Requires firmware version v1.0 This functions stores (parts of) the configurable Pozyx settings in the non-volatile flash memory of the Pozyx device. This function will save the current settings and on the next startup of the Pozyx device these saved settings will be loaded automatically. settings from the flash memory. All registers that are writable, the anchor ids for positioning and the device list (which contains the anchor coordinates) can be saved.

parameterdescription.para: this specifies what should be saved. Possible options are POZYX_FLASH_REGS, POZYX_FLASH_ANCHOR_IDS or POZYX_FLASH_NETWORK.
an option array that holds all the register addresses for which the value must be saved. All registers that are writable are allowed.
optional parameter that determines the length of the registers array.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used.
success.
function failed.
function timed out.

detaileddescription.para:
Save registers to the flash memory. See saveConfiguration for more information
Requires firmware version v1.0

num_registers
optional parameter that determines the length of the registers array.
remote_id
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used.
POZYX_SUCCESS
success.
#POZYX_FAIL
function failed.

function timed out.

clearConfiguration

Clears the configuration.
Requires firmware version v1.0 This function clears (part of) the configuration that was previously stored in the non-volatile Flash memory. The next startup of the Pozyx device will load the default configuration values for the registers, anchor_ids and network list.

parameterdescription.para: optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used.
success.
function failed.

detaileddescription.para:
Verify if a register content is saved in the flash memory.
Requires firmware version v1.0 This function verifies if a given register variable, specified by its address, is saved in flash memory.
regAddress
the register address to check
remote_id
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used.
true(1)
if the register variable is saved
false(0)
if the register variable is not saved
Return the number of register variables saved in flash memory.

parameterdescription.para: optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used.

simplesect.para: the number of register variables saved in flash memory.

detaileddescription.para: Manually set which anchors to use for positioning. Function to manually set which anchors to use for positioning by calling the register function reg:POZYX_POS_SET_ANCHOR_IDS. Notice that the anchors specified are only used if this is configured with setSelectionOfAnchors. Furthermore, the anchors specified in this functions must be available in the device list with their coordinates.

parameterdescription.para: an array with network id's of anchors to be used
the number of anchors write
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used

the number of anchors to read.

detaileddescription.para: Configure the udpate interval for continuous positioning. This function configures the update interval by writing to the register reg:POZYX_POS_INTERVAL. By writing a valid value, the system will start continuous positioning which will generate a position estimate on regular intervals. This will generate a POZYX_INT_STATUS_POS interrupt when interrupts are enabled.

parameterdescription.para: update interval in milliseconds. The update interval must be larger or equal to 100ms.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.
function failed.

optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used

detaileddescription.para: Obtain the anchor selection mode. This function reads the anchor selection mode bit from the register reg:POZYX_POS_NUM_ANCHORS. This bit describes how the anchors are selected for positioning, either manually or automatically.

parameterdescription.para: reference to the anchor selection mode. Possible results are POZYX_ANCHOR_SEL_MANUAL for manual anchor selection or POZYX_ANCHOR_SEL_AUTO for automatic anchor selection.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used

parameterdescription.para: reference to the number of anchors
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used

detaileddescription.para: Configure how many anchors are used for positioning and how they are selected. This function configures the number of anchors used for positioning. Theoretically, a larger number of anchors leads to better positioning performance. However, in practice this is not always the case. The more anchors used for positioning, the longer the positioning process will take. Furthermore, it can be chosen which anchors are to be used: either a fixed set given by the user, or an automatic selection between all the anchors in the internal device list.

parameterdescription.para: describes how the anchors are selected. Possible values are POZYX_ANCHOR_SEL_MANUAL for manual anchor selection or POZYX_ANCHOR_SEL_AUTO for automatic anchor selection.
the number of anchors to use for positioning. Must be larger than 2 and smaller than 16.
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used
success.
function failed.

detaileddescription.para: Obtain the operation mode of the device. This function obtains the operation mode (anchor or tag) by reading from the register reg:POZYX_OPERATION_MODE. This operation mode is independent of the hardware it is on and will have it's effect when performing discovery or auto calibration.

parameterdescription.para: The mode of operations POZYX_ANCHOR_MODE or POZYX_TAG_MODE
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used

detaileddescription.para: Define if the device operates as a tag or an anchor. This function defines how the device should operate (as an anchor or tag) by writing to the register reg:POZYX_OPERATION_MODE. This operation mode is independent of the hardware it is on and will have it's effect when performing discovery or auto calibration. This function overrules the jumper that is present on the board.

parameterdescription.para: The mode of operations POZYX_ANCHOR_MODE or POZYX_TAG_MODE
optional parameter that determines the remote device to be used

memberdef.argsstring: (coordinates_t *coordinates, uint8_t dimension, int32_t height, uint8_t algorithm)
memberdef.name: doPositioning

detaileddescription.para: Obtain the coordinates. This function triggers the positioning algorithm to perform positioning with the given parameters. By default it will automatically select 4 anchors from the internal device list. It will then perform ranging with these anchors and use the results to compute the coordinates. This function requires that the coordinates for the anchors are stored in the internal device list.
Please read the tutorial ready to localize to get started with positioning.

parameterdescription.para: data object to store the result
optional parameter that is used for POZYX_2_5D to give the height in mm of the tag
success.
function failed.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t remote_id, coordinates_t *coordinates, uint8_t dimension, int32_t height, uint8_t algorithm)
memberdef.name: doRemotePositioning

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t remote_id, coordinates_t *coordinates, uint8_t dimension, int32_t height=0)
memberdef.name: doRemotePositioning

detaileddescription.para: Obtain the coordinates of a remote device. Don't use with 2.5D!

This function triggers the positioning algorithm on a remote pozyx device to perform positioning with the given parameters. By default it will automatically select 4 anchors from the internal device list on the remote device. The device will perform ranging with the anchors and use the results to compute the coordinates. This function requires that the coordinates for the anchors are stored in the internal device list on the remote device. After positioning is completed, the remote device will automatically transmit the result back.

parameterdescription.para: the remote device that will do the positioning
data object to store the result
optional parameter that is used for POZYX_2_5D to give the height in mm of the tag
success.
function failed.

detaileddescription.para: Discover Pozyx devices in range. Function to wirelessly discover anchors/tags/all Pozyx devices in range. The discovered devices are added to the internal device list.

parameterdescription.para: which type of device to discover. Possible values are POZYX_DISCOVERY_ANCHORS_ONLY: anchors only, POZYX_DISCOVERY_TAGS_ONLY: tags only or POZYX_DISCOVERY_ALL_DEVICES: anchors and tags
The number of slots to wait for a response of an undiscovered device

memberdef.argsstring: (int dimension=POZYX_2D, int num_measurements=10, int num_anchors=0, uint16_t anchors[]=NULL, int32_t heights[]=NULL)
memberdef.name: doAnchorCalibration

detaileddescription.para:
Automatically obtain the relative anchor positions. WARNING: This is currently experimental and will be improved in the next firmware version! This function triggers the automatic anchor calibration to obtain the relative coordinates of up to 6 pozyx devices in range. This function can be used for quickly setting up the positioning system. The procedure may take several hundres of milliseconds depending on the number of devices in range and the number of range measurements requested. During the calibration proces LED 2 will be turned on. At the end of calibration the corresponding bit in the reg:POZYX_CALIB_STATUS register will be set. The resulting coordinates are stored in the internal device list.
Please read the tutorial Ready to Localize to learn how to use this function.

parameterdescription.para: dimension of the calibration, can be POZYX_2D or POZYX_2_5D
The number of measurements per link. Recommended 10. Theoretically, a larger number should result in better calibration accuracy.
The number of anchors in the anchors[] array
The anchors that determine the axis (see datasheet)
The heights in mm of the anchors in the anchors[] array (only used for POZYX_2_5D)
success.
function failed.
